decks.notes: This Jund aggro deck aims to disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize while putting pressure on the board with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Assassin's Trophy to deal with opposing threats. The planeswalkers Liliana of the Veil and Wrenn and Six provide additional value and control options. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive game plan while still being able to cast its spells consistently.

The deck is focused on assembling the Amulet of Vigor combo to ramp into Primeval Titan quickly. The deck aims to utilize bounce lands and Amulet of Vigor to generate large amounts of mana and activate Primeval Titan's ability to search for key lands like Boros Garrison, Sunhome, Fortress of the Legion, and Field of the Dead to overwhelm the opponent with large creatures and generate an insurmountable board state. The deck also includes interaction and utility cards like Engineered Explosives and Reclamation Sage to deal with threats from opponents.

The deck focuses on utilizing interactive control spells and creatures to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also gaining card advantage through cards like Snapcaster Mage and Teferi, Time Raveler. The deck also utilizes powerful equipment like Sword of Feast and Famine and Batterskull to help close out the game. By efficiently disrupting the opponent and generating value, the deck aims to control the game and ultimately win through superior card advantage and powerful threats.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. By utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, along with efficient removal like Lightning Bolt and Path to Exile, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan and eventually take over the game with powerful late-game threats. The mana base is structured to provide the right colors for its spells, while also including utility lands like Field of Ruin to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main idea of this deck is to protect your creatures with auras that grant hexproof, allowing you to build up powerful creatures that are difficult for your opponent to deal with. By using a combination of auras such as Rancor, Unflinching Courage, and Ethereal Armor, you can quickly boost your creature's power and toughness while keeping them safe from targeted removal. This deck is focused on aggressive play and maintaining a strong board presence with hexproof creatures like Slippery Bogle and Gladecover Scout, making it difficult for your opponent to stop your relentless attacks.

The main concept of this Aggro - Red Deck Wins archetype is to apply constant pressure on the opponent using efficient burn spells and low-cost aggressive creatures. The deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total while controlling the board with removal spells like Lightning Helix and Searing Blaze. Cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel punish opponents for casting spells, while creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear deal consistent damage. The deck's mana base allows for consistent casting of spells and the ability to close out games quickly.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using cards like Leonin Arbiter and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to tax their resources, while also utilizing cards like Tidehollow Sculler and Thought-Knot Seer to strip their hand of key cards. The deck also has the ability to manipulate the board with cards like Eldrazi Displacer and Flickerwisp, creating advantageous board states. Overall, the deck looks to control the game through disruption and pressure, overwhelming the opponent with a combination of aggression and resource denial.

The deck relies on quickly reducing your own life total to take advantage of Death's Shadow's ability, while disrupting your opponent's game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Tidehollow Sculler. Ranger-Captain of Eos helps find key creatures, and Kolaghan's Command provides versatility in dealing with threats. Temur Battle Rage can help finish off opponents quickly, while Path to Exile and Fatal Push deal with opposing creatures. Mishra's Bauble can provide card advantage and Unearth can bring back key creatures from the graveyard. The deck aims to control the game while putting pressure on the opponent.

This deck focuses on maximizing the effect of +1/+1 counters, using cards like Hardened Scales and Arcbound Ravager to quickly grow creatures and overwhelm opponents. Combining artifacts like Walking Ballista and Hangarback Walker with modular abilities, along with synergistic cards like Animation Module and Metallic Mimic, creates a powerful aggro strategy that can put pressure on opponents early and close out games quickly. The inclusion of utility lands like Pendelhaven and Blast Zone provides additional control options, while cards like Mox Opal and Ancient Stirrings help with consistency and card selection.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures that can attack early and often. By maximizing the use of cheap, direct damage spells and creatures with haste, the deck aims to pressure the opponent, minimizing their ability to stabilize and win the game before they have a chance to mount a defense. The deck also includes cards that prevent the opponent from gaining life or using certain defensive strategies, allowing the aggressive strategy to remain effective throughout the game.

This Merfolk deck focuses on establishing a strong board presence quickly by using Merfolk lords like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident to pump up all Merfolk creatures. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Harbinger of the Tides and Merfolk Trickster to control the opponent's board. With Aether Vial to cheat out creatures and Force of Negation to protect your key cards, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive Merfolk creatures while maintaining control over the battlefield with tempo plays.

This deck focuses on utilizing Jeskai Ascendancy to create a powerful combo engine, fueled by low-cost spells and mana creatures. By chaining spells together and untapping mana creatures, the deck can generate a large amount of mana and draw through the deck quickly. Glittering Wish acts as a versatile tutor, allowing the player to search for key pieces or answers as needed. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces and win the game through a massive flurry of spells and triggers, overwhelming the opponent with its explosive synergy.

This Jund Aggro deck focuses on disruption and efficiency, utilizing powerful cards like Liliana of the Veil and Tarmogoyf to control the board while applying pressure. With a mix of removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Assassin's Trophy, as well as hand disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while presenting threats of its own. The inclusion of Wrenn and Six provides card advantage and synergy with the deck's land base, enhancing its consistency and resilience in the long game.

The deck relies on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Primeval Titan and Sakura-Tribe Elder to combo off with Scapeshift and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle. By tutoring for Valakut and mountains with Primeval Titan, the deck can deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent's creatures or life total in one turn. Prismatic Omen ensures all lands count as mountains, maximizing the effectiveness of Valakut. The deck aims to ramp quickly and overwhelm the opponent with a massive burst of damage, utilizing the combo potential of Valakut and Scapeshift.

The deck aims to quickly ramp up mana with cards like Farseek and Search for Tomorrow, allowing the player to cast Scapeshift and fetch Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle along with multiple mountains. By sacrificing lands and triggering Valakut's ability, the player can deal massive damage to the opponent, often winning the game in a single turn. Primeval Titan also helps accelerate the process by fetching additional lands. The deck heavily relies on assembling the Valakut combo as quickly as possible to overwhelm the opponent with direct damage.

This Spirit Aggro deck focuses on utilizing creatures with flash and disruptive abilities to control the board and apply pressure to the opponent. By efficiently using Aether Vial, Mausoleum Wanderer, and Spell Queller, the deck can continuously disrupt the opponent's game plan while developing its own board presence. With Drogskol Captain providing a power boost to all spirit creatures and protection from targeted removal, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive spirit creatures and powerful equipment like Sword of Fire and Ice and Batterskull.
